a2dZmn.plunkDescription:
• Declare simple properties (Boolean, String, Number, Date) in a static properties getter.
  • Initialize values for simple properties in the static properties getter.
  • Initialize values for simple properties from attributes in markup.

JGiZug.plunkDescription:
For simple properties (Boolean, String, Number, Date), set a property change observer from the static properties getter.

There are two ways to set a property change observer for a simple property:

  • Specify the observer function with a string matching its name
  • Refer to the observer function directly

ov8uvE.plunkDescription:
• Declare complex properties (Array and Object) in a static properties getter.
  • Use functions to initialize values for complex properties in the static properties getter.
  • Initialize values for complex properties from attributes in markup.
  • Set and use a property change observer for a complex property.

JK0RxT.plunkDescription: For complex properties (Array and Object), set a property change observer by...

W07H4B.plunkDescription:
• Declare a computed property.
  • Demonstrate that Polymer computes a computed property when at least 1 of its dependencies is defined.

5WXg21.plunkDescription: Demonstrate that property observers are synchronous.

nLPcIZ.plunkDescription: Use Polymer features to declaratively add annotated event listeners.

YBcwSb.plunkDescription: Add an event listener imperatively to a custom element.

SDymtm.plunkDescription:
Update an array so that the Polymer data system can detect the changes.
  • Update an array observably using Polymer array functions.
  • Show what happens when an array is updated unobservably with standard JavaScript array functions.
  • Update an array unobservably with standard JavaScript array functions; then notify the Polymer data system manually, using notifySplices.

w3Lkr0.plunkTitle: Set a property change observer for an array
w3Lkr0.plunkDescription:
• Update array properties observably.
  • Receive array property change notifications.

P541Ce.plunkDescription:
• Create a read-only property.
  • Update a read-only property with a generated setter.

vYncKAWwYldiEQax5PW6.plunkDescription: Keep an HTML attribute value in sync with its corresponding property value by using the reflectToAttribute flag.

FUPiaQ.plunkTitle: Create a Polymer element with shadow DOM
FUPiaQ.plunkDescription: Create a simple Polymer element with shadow DOM.

Qb3Ibn.plunkTitle: Understand shadow DOM vs light DOM
Qb3Ibn.plunkDescription: Understand the difference between shadow DOM and light DOM.

xaNZjE.plunkTitle: Create shadow DOM declaratively with Polymer
xaNZjE.plunkDescription: Create shadow DOM declaratively with Polymer

27qNnX.plunkDescription: Use the slot element to render an element's light dom children

i4a0DS.plunkTitle: Assign an element to a named slot
i4a0DS.plunkDescription:
• Use named slots and the slot attribute to assign light DOM elements to specific slots.
  • Demonstrate that un-named slots receive any light DOM child without a slot attribute.
  • Demonstrate that a named slot with no matching light DOM children receives no children.

E0rJL3.plunkTitle: Multiple unnamed slots; one thing to slot
E0rJL3.plunkDescription: Demonstrate what happens when you have multiple unnamed slots and one thing to be slotted

73Fl77.plunkTitle: One unnamed slot; multiple things to slot
73Fl77.plunkDescription: Demonstrate what happens when you have one unnamed slot and multiple things to be slotted

thKiy4.plunkTitle: Use fallback content for a slot
thKiy4.plunkDescription: Create a slot that displays fallback content when nothing is provided to be slotted.

oOj3rw.plunkTitle: Assign a slot to a slot
oOj3rw.plunkDescription: Assign a slot element to a slot (use multilevel distribution)

kWXs2o.plunkDescription: Demonstrate the flattened DOM for parent and child elements with populated slots

tnPr7r.plunkTitle: Find which slot an element is in
tnPr7r.plunkDescription:
Use the Shadow DOM Slot APIs to find info about the elements assigned to slots.
  • Use the HTMLSlotElement.assignedSlot function to determine which slot an element is in.
  • Use the HTMLSlotElement.assignedNodes() function to determine the element that is assigned to a slot.

m7bVdk.plunkDescription: Return the distributed nodes for a slot

MSN2FC.plunkDescription:
• Detect changes to slot content.

iJ3IZf.plunkDescription:
• Listen for events in shadow trees.
  • Handle retargeted events.
  • Retrieve the composedPath of an event.
  • Demonstrate how events are retargeted as they move through a shadow tree.

pqhTCW.plunkDescription: Use functions to initialize arrays and objects. This ensures that each element gets its own copy of the value, rather than having an object or array shared across all instances of the element.

OJibHI.plunkTitle: Initialize arrays and objects from markup
OJibHI.plunkDescription: Initialize object and array properties from markup.
